Key Match Events: Yoshinobu Yamamoto shut out the San Diego Padres for five innings, retiring 12 of the last 13 batters he faced
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers thought they could rely on a pitcher who was known in his home country for his resiliency
Manager Dave Roberts called attention to Yamamoto's international experience
Post-Match Reflections: Yamamoto said he received words of encouragement from teammates, including Kiké Hernández, who invited him out to dinner in San Diego
Shohei Ohtani approached Yamamoto with a bottle of sparkling wine and emptied it on him
Yamamoto joked that the alcohol got in him through his skin
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the first postseason game to feature two Japanese starters, with Yu Darvish pitching for the Padres
The game was broadcast live in Japan on network television
Others: Yamamoto's night was over, at least on the mound, after throwing only 63 pitches
Roberts was mindful that Yamamoto hadn't pitched into the sixth inning since he blanked the New York Yankees over seven innings on June 7
